alert.note: Alert for Adams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:38PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL ADAMS COUNTY THROUGH 615 PM EDT... At 538 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over West Union, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, nickel size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... West Union, Manchester, Blue Creek, Bentonville, Dunkinsville, Bradysville, State Route 348 at State Route 125, Wamsley and Cedar Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
